textos_fuente.text: Long Marsh - Rotonda Skip to content Menu Menu Home Golf Courses Long Marsh Course The Palms Course The Hills Course Pinemoor Course The Links Course Rotonda Golf Academy Membership Events Weddings Tournaments Banquets The Hills Restaurant Shop Contact Book a Tee Time Long Marsh A Deep Dive into What Makes Each of Rotonda’s Courses Unique and Challenging June 28, 2024 June 8, 2024 by admin Rotonda Golf & Country Club boasts some of the most diverse and challenging golf courses in Southwest Florida, each offering unique experiences for both novice and experienced golfers. This guide explores what makes each of Rotonda’s courses distinctively appealing and challenging, enhancing your golfing experience whether you’re planning to become a member or just visiting … Read more Categories Blog , Long Marsh , Palms Golf Course , Pinemoor Golf Course , Rotonda Golf & Country Club , The Hills Course Tags Hills Golf Course , Links Course , Long Marsh Golf Course , Palms Golf Course , Pinemoor Golf Course , Rotonda Golf , Rotonda Golf Club A Guide to Choosing the Right Course at Rotonda Golf & Country Club June 28, 2024 May 24, 2024 by admin Rotonda Golf & Country Club, located in the picturesque Rotonda West near Englewood, is a haven for golf enthusiasts. With its five beautifully maintained courses, each offering unique challenges and layouts, choosing the right course can enhance your golfing experience. Whether you’re a resident of nearby Englewood or visiting from afar, here’s how to select … Read more Categories Links Course , Long Marsh , Palms Golf Course , Pinemoor Golf Course , Rotonda Golf & Country Club , The Hills Course Tags Links Course , Long Marsh Golf Course , Palms Golf Course , Pinemoor Golf Course , Rotonda Golf , Rotonda Golf Academy , Rotonda Golf Club Planning Your Dream Wedding at Rotonda Golf & Country Club June 28, 2024 May 17, 2024 by admin Nestled in the heart of Southwest Florida, Rotonda Golf & Country Club offers a stunning backdrop for your dream wedding. With its lush greenery, serene water features, and comprehensive amenities, Rotonda is not just a venue but a destination that promises a day of elegance and joy. Here’s why you should consider celebrating your special … Read more Categories Long Marsh , Palms Golf Course , Pinemoor Golf Course , Rotonda Golf & Country Club , The Hills Course Tags Eco-Friendly Golfing , Hills Golf Course , Links Course , Long Marsh Golf Course , Palms Golf Course , Pinemoor Golf Course , Rotonda Golf Long Marsh: A Rotonda Golf Adventure for All Skill Levels April 18, 2024 April 17, 2024 by Rotonda Golf Located along the lush landscapes of Florida, Long Marsh Golf Club at Rotonda offers a unique and inclusive golfing experience suitable for players of all skill levels. From beginners to seasoned golfers, Long Marsh provides an engaging and scenic setting where everyone can enjoy the game and improve their skills. Here’s why Long Marsh is … Read more Categories Long Marsh Search Search Recent Posts Elevate Your Game at Rotonda Golf Academy: Perfect Your Swing in Paradise Create Lasting Memories: Celebrate Life’s Special Occasions at Rotonda Golf & Country Club A Deep Dive into What Makes Each of Rotonda’s Courses Unique and Challenging How to Improve Your Golf Game at Rotonda’s Golf Academy A Guide to Choosing the Right Course at Rotonda Golf & Country Club Recent Comments No comments to show. Come on out and give us a visit. The weather is great. The courses are great. All in your own backyard. That’s exactly how Rotonda Golf & Country Club’s five courses were planned. Elevate Your Game at Rotonda Golf Academy: Perfect Your Swing in Paradise - Rotonda Skip to content Menu Menu Home Golf Courses Long Marsh Course The Palms Course The Hills Course Pinemoor Course The Links Course Rotonda Golf Academy Membership Events Weddings Tournaments Banquets The Hills Restaurant Shop Contact Book a Tee Time Elevate Your Game at Rotonda Golf Academy: Perfect Your Swing in Paradise June 28, 2024 June 26, 2024 by admin Looking to take your golf game to the next level? Look no further than Rotonda Golf Academy, located within the prestigious Rotonda Golf & Country Club . Nestled amidst the stunning beauty of Englewood, Florida, our academy offers expert instruction and state-of-the-art facilities to help golfers of all skill levels improve their game. Come and experience the ultimate golfing experience at Rotonda Golf Academy. Contact us today to schedule your lesson . Expert Instruction from PGA Professionals At Rotonda Golf Academy , our team of PGA professionals is dedicated to helping you achieve your golfing goals. Whether you’re a beginner looking to learn the basics or an experienced player striving to refine your technique, our instructors provide personalized instruction tailored to your individual needs. Book your lesson with one of our PGA professionals today. Visit our website to meet our instructors. State-of-the-Art Facilities Our academy boasts state-of-the-art facilities designed to provide an optimal learning environment. From spacious practice areas to cutting-edge technology, including video analysis and launch monitors, we offer everything you need to enhance your skills and reach your full potential on the course. Comprehensive Lesson Programs Whether you prefer private lessons, group clinics, or multi-day golf schools, Rotonda Golf Academy offers a variety of lesson programs to suit your needs and schedule. Our comprehensive instruction covers all aspects of the game, including swing mechanics, short game techniques, course management, and mental strategies. Contact us to learn more about our lesson programs and find the perfect option for you. Visit our website for details on our lesson offerings. Perfect Your Game in Paradise Located just minutes from Englewood Beach, Rotonda Golf & Country Club provides the perfect backdrop for improving your golf game. With five stunning courses to choose from, including The Hills , Long Marsh , The Palms , The Links , and Pinemoor , you’ll find a challenging and scenic setting to hone your skills. Join us at Rotonda Golf Academy and elevate your game in paradise. Book your lesson today and experience golfing excellence. Visit our website to explore our course options. Unmatched Golfing Experience At Rotonda Golf & Country Club, we pride ourselves on offering an unmatched golfing experience for players of all levels. Our well-maintained fairways, picturesque scenery, and gulf breezes create the perfect ambiance for enjoying the game you love. Don’t miss out on the opportunity to play at one of Englewood’s premier golf destinations. Contact us to schedule your lesson at Rotonda Golf Academy . Visit our website to learn more about our club amenities. Visit Rotonda Golf & Country Club Today Whether you’re a local resident or visiting Englewood, there’s no better place to play golf than Rotonda Golf & Country Club. Come and see for yourself why our courses are hailed as “five emeralds in a spectacular setting” and experience the beauty and challenge that awaits you on our fairways. Plan your visit to Rotonda Golf & Country Club today. Contact us to book your tee time and explore everything our club has to offer. Visit our website to learn more about our facilities and amenities. At Rotonda Golf Academy, we’re dedicated to helping you unlock your full potential on the golf course. Join us and take the first step towards becoming the golfer you’ve always wanted to be. Contact us now to schedule your lesson and start your journey to golfing greatness. Long Marsh Golf Club - Experience Ultimate Golfing Adventure Skip to content Menu Menu Home Golf Courses Long Marsh Course The Palms Course The Hills Course Pinemoor Course The Links Course Rotonda Golf Academy Membership Events Weddings Tournaments Banquets The Hills Restaurant Shop Contact Book a Tee Time Long Marsh Course Long Marsh Course Reservation To book a tee time, please click the link below or call 941-698-0918 Click here to Book Tee Time Long Marsh, 27 Holes Long Marsh’s gently rolling fairways meander through 450 acres of natural Florida scrub. Its fairways and greens invitingly framed by native pines, oaks and palms and is Rotonda’s newest golf courses. This Ted McAnlis-designed course opened in February of 1999, and it’s newest 9 Hole addition in 2007 and is enjoyable for golfers of all levels. At Long Marsh Golf Club in Rotonda West , each hole has its own distinctive character, set amid natural bunkers, lakes and marshes that are haven for wildlife. Five sets of tee boxes provide course distances ranging from 5257 yards to 7120 yards. Semi-Private – Architect: Ted McAnlis Year Opened: 1999 9 Hole Extension at Pine Valley 2007 For Tee Times Call: 941-698-0918 20 White Marsh Rd Rotonda, FL, 33947 Scorecard Book a Tee Time Select a course and book your next round of golf online. It’s fast and easy! Set up a Tee Time Now Tournament Info Our experienced event specialists will make your golf tournament a total success. View the Schedule or Book Weddings Our wide array of options from dining, decor, and location makes planning your special event a cinch. Learn More Rotonda Golf Academy Rick brings over 30 years of studying the golf swing and teaching experience. He is the former Director… Learn More Come on out and give us a visit. The weather is great. The courses are great. All in your own backyard. That’s exactly how Rotonda Golf & Country Club’s five courses were planned. Best Golf Courses Port Charlotte - Rotonda Golf Skip to content Menu Menu Home Golf Courses Long Marsh Course The Palms Course The Hills Course Pinemoor Course The Links Course Rotonda Golf Academy Membership Events Weddings Tournaments Banquets The Hills Restaurant Shop Contact Book a Tee Time Welcome to Rotonda Golf & Country Club Book Tee Time The Country Club Life Rotonda Golf & Country Club has been awarded a “Beginner Friendly Certification” from the National Golf Course Owners Association as well as numerous Charlotte Sun Herald’s Reader’s choice awards. Come on out and give us a visit. The weather is great. The courses are great. All in your own backyard. That’s exactly how Rotonda Golf & Country Club’s five courses were planned. The Hills. Long Marsh. The Palms. The Links and now Pinemoor. Five emeralds in a spectacular setting bathed by gulf breezes. Challenging, well maintained fairways that provide a new golfing experience with every round. Rotonda Golf & Country Club is located just minutes from Englewood Beach. This popular destination attracts visitors all year round and is the perfect place to take the kids. There is no better place in Englewood to play golf than Rotonda Golf & Country Club. More Memberships All memberships options include 99 Holes of Golf 5 Golf Courses to choose from every day FREE Range Balls Advance Tee Time privileges 10% Pro Shop Discount Never any assessments No food and beverage requirements No charge Handicap index through the USGA/ Florida State Golf Association. The Hills Restaurant Featuring made from scratch dishes from our chefs. The Rotonda Hills Restaurant is Open to the Public on Wednesday & Friday nights for Dinner and Sundays for Breakfast. Offering new food and drink specials every week, we’ll give you even more reasons to come back over and over again. View our menus online and make a reservation with us. See Menu Reservations Events at the Golf Course. Taste the Good Life Are you planning a wedding, reunion, birthday celebration, or corporate gathering? Bring your group to Rotonda Golf & Country Club for a time they’ll never forget. At one of Southwest Florida’s friendliest clubs, your guests will enjoy the same comforts and services our members and residents enjoy throughout the year. Read More Come on out and give us a visit. The weather is great. The courses are great. All in your own backyard. That’s exactly how Rotonda Golf & Country Club’s five courses were planned. Golf Courses in Englewood - Englewood Golf Courses Skip to content Menu Menu Home Golf Courses Long Marsh Course The Palms Course The Hills Course Pinemoor Course The Links Course Rotonda Golf Academy Membership Events Weddings Tournaments Banquets The Hills Restaurant Shop Contact Book a Tee Time Golf Courses in Englewood Discover the Finest Golfing Experience in Rotonda West, Florida Book A Tee Time Golf courses in Englewood, FL Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced golfer in Englewood, Rotonda Golf & Country Club has something for everyone. With its beautiful courses and friendly staff, it’s no wonder why it has been awarded the ‘Beginner Friendly Certification’ by the National Golf Course Owners Association. Rotonda Golf & Country Club is located just minutes away from Englewood Beach, making it the perfect destination for golf. The five courses at Rotonda Golf & Country Club offer a variety of challenges and stunning views. The Hills course features rolling hills and water hazards, while Long Marsh offers a more secluded and natural setting. The Palms course showcases its namesake trees, and The Links provides a true links-style experience. The newest addition, Pinemoor , offers a unique and enjoyable golfing experience. Not only are the courses at Rotonda Golf & Country Club well-maintained, but they also provide a new experience with every round. Whether you’re looking for a leisurely game or a competitive round, you’ll find it at Rotonda Golf & Country Club. So why wait? Come visit Rotonda Golf & Country Club and experience the country club life for yourself. The weather is great, the courses are great, and it’s all right in your own backyard. Explore Our Golf Courses in Englewood Long Marsh Course A Scenic and Strategic 27-Hole Layout This expansive course is set on 450 acres of natural Florida landscape, perfect for golfers who enjoy open fairways and wildlife views. The Palms Course Challenge Your Game with Water and Sand A true test of accuracy, this par-72 course is known for its multiple water hazards and strategic bunkering—ideal for competitive play. The Hills Course A Renovated Classic Full of Character Among the top golf courses in Englewood , this layout features elevation changes, rolling terrain, and newly updated greens for a fresh challenge. Pinemoor Course Relaxed Rounds, Expertly Designed A player-friendly par-70 course that’s easy to walk and enjoyable for all ages. Perfect for casual golfers near Englewood. The Links Course Executive-Style Golf Near Englewood Designed for fast-paced play, this par-63 course includes 9 par-3s and 9 par-4s—ideal for working on your short game. Book Your Tee Time at the Best Golf Courses in Englewood Rotonda Golf & Country Club makes it easy to book your next round. Whether you’re a local or visiting Englewood, our online tee time system and friendly staff are ready to help. Memberships All memberships options include 99 Holes of Golf 5 Golf Courses to choose from every day FREE Range Balls Advance Tee Time privileges 10% Pro Shop Discount Never any assessments No food and beverage requirements No charge Handicap index through the USGA/ Florida State Golf Association. Come on out and give us a visit. The weather is great. The courses are great. All in your own backyard. That’s exactly how Rotonda Golf & Country Club’s five courses were planned. A Guide to Choosing the Right Course at Rotonda Golf & Country Club - Rotonda Skip to content Menu Menu Home Golf Courses Long Marsh Course The Palms Course The Hills Course Pinemoor Course The Links Course Rotonda Golf Academy Membership Events Weddings Tournaments Banquets The Hills Restaurant Shop Contact Book a Tee Time A Guide to Choosing the Right Course at Rotonda Golf & Country Club June 28, 2024 May 24, 2024 by admin Rotonda Golf & Country Club , located in the picturesque Rotonda West near Englewood, is a haven for golf enthusiasts. With its five beautifully maintained courses, each offering unique challenges and layouts, choosing the right course can enhance your golfing experience. Whether you’re a resident of nearby Englewood or visiting from afar, here’s how to select the perfect course for your next round of golf. Understanding the Five Courses 1. Long Marsh Golf Course Long Marsh is known for its natural beauty, sprawling over 450 acres. The course features a mix of long and short holes, challenging the golfer with a variety of water hazards and marshes. It’s ideal for those who enjoy a tactical game amidst serene landscapes. 2. The Palms Golf Course The Palms Golf Course offers a forgiving layout suitable for all skill levels but don’t let its openness deceive you. Strategic water hazards and sand traps are placed to challenge more experienced players. This course is perfect if you’re looking for a relaxed round or are new to the game. 3. The Hills Golf Course The Hills Course presents elevation changes with well-placed bunkers and rolling fairways. It is favored by players who enjoy a physical and visual challenge. The course layout demands precision, making it thrilling for competitive golfers. 4. The Links Course The Links Course is the only par-63 course at Rotonda, offering a quicker play ideal for those on a tight schedule. It features several par-three and par-four holes, perfect for improving your short game in a picturesque setting. 5. Pinemoor Golf Course Pinemoor Course is known for its relaxed atmosphere and player-friendly design. With wider fairways and fewer hazards, it’s suited for beginners and those looking to enjoy a leisurely game. Membership Benefits Choosing a course at Rotonda isn’t just about the play; it’s also about the perks. Membership at Rotonda Golf & Country Club offers significant advantages, including unlimited access to all five courses. Members enjoy advanced tee time privileges, free range balls, and discounts at the Pro Shop. Whether you’re a local resident or a frequent visitor from Englewood or surrounding areas, becoming a member can significantly enhance your golfing experience. Dining and Events After your round, visit The Hills Restaurant located within the club. Open to the public with special dining events throughout the week, it offers a fantastic menu in a setting that overlooks the beautiful courses. The club is also an excellent venue for banquets, weddings, and other special events, providing a picturesque backdrop and full-service catering. Englewood and Beyond For those living in Englewood or neighboring cities looking for a superior golfing experience, Rotonda Golf & Country Club represents a significant upgrade over local options. With its variety of courses and top-notch facilities, it’s well worth the short trip to Rotonda West. Choose the right Golf Course Rotonda Golf & Country Club stands out as a premier golf destination in Southwest Florida. With courses designed to suit all skill levels and styles, along with exceptional member benefits, dining, and event services, choosing the right course here means gearing up for an unforgettable golfing adventure. Whether you’re refining your game, competing, or simply enjoying the scenery, Rotonda has a course perfectly suited to your needs. Contact Rotonda Golf Course today to experience the serenity and the fun that comes with it. Leadership Media Center Careers Contact Us Insights Climate Resilience Emerging Risks Generative AI Healthy Societies Innovations in Infrastructure Transformative Technologies Workforce for the Future Solutions Automotive Energy Financial Institutions Healthcare Insurance Retail / Consumer Products Technology Cyber Digital Public Sector M&A Advisory Investors Reporting Quarterly Earnings Annual Reports + Proxy Statements SEC Filings Events & Presentations Stocks & Dividend Information Dividend Information Stock Chart Investment Calculator Historical Price Lookup Shareholder Information Stock Quote Email Alerts About Leadership Culture Careers Business Responsibility Corporate Governance Our Capabilities Heritage Marsh McLennan's Code of Conduct Search MARSH & McLENNAN COMPANIES Leadership We are in business to expand what’s possible for our clients and each other Meet Our President & CEO John Q. Doyle is an industry veteran with more than 35 years of management experience. More about John Meet Our President & CEO John Q. Doyle is an industry veteran with more than 35 years of management experience. More about John Leadership is a mindset, not a title. We believe our leaders have an elevated duty to amplify impact: making our clients more successful, our communities more resilient, our people more empowered and our company more enduring. Learn about our leaders below. Marsh McLennan Executive Committee Paul Beswick SVP & Chief Information and Operations Officer Katherine J. Brennan SVP & General Counsel John Q. Doyle President & Chief Executive Officer Carmen Fernandez SVP & Chief People Officer John Jones SVP & Chief Marketing and Communications Officer Dean Klisura President & CEO, Guy Carpenter Mark McGivney SVP & Chief Financial Officer Martin South President & CEO, Marsh Nick Studer President & CEO, Oliver Wyman Group Pat Tomlinson President & CEO, Mercer Paul Beswick SVP & Chief Information and Operations Officer Mr. Beswick is Senior Vice President and the Global Chief Information and Operations Officer of Marsh McLennan. In this role, he oversees Marsh McLennan's Business and Client Services function which brings together our Operations and Technology teams in support of the firm’s global businesses.

Prior to his appointment as Chief Information and Operations Officer, Mr. Beswick variously served as Marsh McLennan’s Chief Information Officer, Deputy CIO, and Global Head of Oliver Wyman Labs and the Digital Practice at Oliver Wyman. With more than two decades at Oliver Wyman, he worked across various sectors, including financial services, retail, transportation, telecoms, and consumer goods. Mr. Beswick holds an MA (first class) in chemical engineering from Cambridge University. Katherine J. Brennan SVP & General Counsel Ms. Brennan leads Marsh McLennan’s global legal, compliance and public affairs function, which supports the Company’s four businesses, Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman.  She also leads the Company’s ESG efforts. Ms. Brennan has held several legal and compliance leadership roles at Marsh McLennan, serving most recently as General Counsel, Marsh LLC. She also served as Deputy General Counsel, Corporate Secretary and Chief Compliance Officer for Marsh McLennan from 2017 to 2021, and prior to that, as General Counsel of Guy Carpenter. Ms. Brennan currently serves on the Board of the Red Cross of Greater New York. John Q. Doyle President & Chief Executive Officer Mr. Doyle is President and CEO of Marsh McLennan. Previously, Mr. Doyle served as Group President and Chief Operating Officer, responsible for the strategy and operational objectives of Marsh McLennan’s four global businesses. He joined the firm in 2016 as President of Marsh, then led Marsh as President and CEO from 2017 to 2021. An industry veteran with more than 35 years of management experience, Mr. Doyle began his career at AIG, where he held several executive positions. He is a Trustee of the Inner-City Scholarship Fund, a member of the Board of Overseers of the Maurice R. Greenberg School of Risk Management, Insurance and Actuarial Science at St. John’s University, and a member of the Board of the New York Police and Fire Widows’ and Children’s Benefit Fund. Mr. Doyle serves as the Chairman of the US Federal Advisory Committee on Insurance. Carmen Fernandez SVP & Chief People Officer Ms. Fernandez is responsible for our people strategy and capabilities, to support our colleagues’ growth and our businesses’ priorities. Prior to her current role, Ms. Fernandez held positions within Marsh McLennan for 15 years, most recently Deputy CHRO, CHRO of Guy Carpenter, and HR leadership roles at Mercer, including North America HR Leader, Global HR Leader for the Career business and Chief of Staff in the Office of the CEO. Before joining Marsh McLennan, Ms. Fernandez worked in investment banking at Goldman Sachs and Bank of America. She began her career as a consultant with PricewaterhouseCoopers. John Jones SVP & Chief Marketing and Communications Officer As SVP and Chief Marketing and Communications Officer, Mr. Jones is responsible for the marketing and communications strategy for Marsh McLennan and its four global businesses. Previously he was Chief Marketing and Communications Officer of Marsh. Mr. Jones joined Marsh in 2016 as Senior Vice President, Business Planning, leading strategic development and global growth initiatives. Prior to that, he was Senior Vice President of Commercial Marketing and Strategy for AIG and has more than 25 years of marketing, communications and strategy experience. He graduated from Indiana University with a BA in political science and history, and a minor in Russian language. Dean Klisura President & CEO, Guy Carpenter Dean Klisura is President & CEO of Guy Carpenter, responsible for all of Guy Carpenter’s businesses and operations globally. He is also Vice Chair of Marsh McLennan.
Dean has significant insurance industry experience. Prior to joining Guy Carpenter in 2020, he held a number of executive roles at Marsh, including President of Global Placement, Specialties and Advisory Services. Dean joined Marsh in 1993.
Dean is a member of the Board of Directors of Blue Marble, an organization that develops insurance protection for the underserved, and The Institutes Knowledge Group, which is dedicated to helping the risk management and insurance industries better serve the public. Dean holds a BS in Finance from Santa Clara University. Mark McGivney SVP & Chief Financial Officer Mr. McGivney has held a number of senior financial management positions since joining the Company in 2007, including Chief Financial Officer of Marsh and Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer of Mercer. In his most recent role as Senior Vice President, Corporate Finance of Marsh McLennan, Mr. McGivney was responsible for leading and directing the Company’s Corporate Development, Treasury and Investor Relations functions. His prior experience includes senior positions at The Hanover Insurance Group, including serving as Senior Vice President of Finance, Treasurer, and Chief Financial Officer of the Property & Casualty business, and investment banking positions at Merrill Lynch and PriceWaterhouseCoopers. Martin South President & CEO, Marsh Mr. South is President and Chief Executive Officer of Marsh and oversees all of Marsh’s businesses and operations globally. He is also Vice Chair of Marsh McLennan. With more than 30 years in the insurance industry, Mr. South joined Marsh for the first time in 1985 with Bowring Marsh, a Marsh McLennan broking unit. His industry experience includes senior leadership roles at Zurich Financial Services, where he was a member of the Group Management Board, responsible for all of Zurich’s operations outside of North America and Europe, and CEO of Zurich’s London operations. Since rejoining Marsh in 2007, Mr. South has served as CEO of Marsh’s Asia-Pacific region, CEO of Marsh UK and Ireland, CEO of Marsh Europe and CEO of Marsh US and Canada. Nick Studer President & CEO, Oliver Wyman Group Mr. Studer is the President and Chief Executive Officer of Oliver Wyman Group and Vice Chair of Marsh McLennan. Prior, he was the Managing Partner of Oliver Wyman and has held many senior positions, including Managing Partner of the Consumer, Industrial, and Services Practice, Managing Partner of the Financial Services Practice, and Head of the European Finance and Risk Practice. He has over 20 years of experience consulting in the UK, Continental Europe, and North America. Mr. Studer was a founding Director of TheCityUK, a founding advisory board member of the FICC Markets Standards Board and is a member of the Sustainable Markets Initiative. Mr. Studer graduated with a First Class Honors degree in Manufacturing Engineering from Cambridge University. Pat Tomlinson President & CEO, Mercer Mr. Tomlinson is President and Chief Executive Officer of Mercer and Vice Chair of Marsh McLennan. Mr. Tomlinson also serves as CEO of Marsh McLennan US and Canada, with responsibility for leading across businesses to address clients’ increasingly interconnected risk, strategy and people challenges. Mr. Tomlinson joined Mercer in 2014 as US and Canada Career business leader and, from 2018 to 2020, led the US East Market, where he guided Mercer's Health, Wealth, and Career businesses to meet ever-changing client needs. Prior to joining Mercer, he spent 17 years with Aon and served as an officer in the US Army. Mr. Tomlinson is a graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point with a bachelor of science in sociology. Marsh McLennan Board of Directors Anthony K. Anderson Bruce Broussard John Q. Doyle H. Edward Hanway Judith Hartmann Deborah C. Hopkins Tamara Ingram Jane Lute Steven A. Mills Morton O. Schapiro Jan Siegmund Lloyd M. Yates Anthony K. Anderson Mr. Anderson served as Vice Chair and Midwest Area Managing Partner of Ernst & Young LLP from 2006 until his retirement in April 2012. He joined Ernst & Young in 1977 and held various management positions during his 35-year career. Throughout his career, Mr. Anderson served the financial services industry, focused on insurance companies and brokers. Mr. Anderson served on the Board of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago from 2008 to 2010. He is a member of the American, California and Illinois Institutes of Certified Public Accountants. Mr. Anderson is a former director of Avery Dennison Corporation, Exelon Corporation, AAR Corporation and First American Financial Corporation. Bruce Broussard Bruce Broussard served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Humana Inc., a leading healthcare company, from 2013 through 2024. During his tenure, he led Humana through a period of significant transformation and growth, evolving it into an integrated health services organization with a strong focus on senior care. Prior to Humana, Mr. Broussard was Chief Executive Officer of McKesson Specialty/US Oncology, Inc., where he held senior leadership roles for over a decade—including CFO, President, CEO, and Chairman, guiding the company through substantial expansion and its eventual acquisition by McKesson.

 

Mr. Broussard also serves on the boards of directors of HP Inc., Cleveland Clinic and One Call. Additionally, he holds leadership positions in numerous advocacy organizations, including The Business Council and the American Heart Association’s CEO Roundtable. He is also the Chair of the Board of Directors of the Trust for the National Mall, a nonprofit philanthropic partner of the National Park Service dedicated to restoring and preserving the National Mall. John Q. Doyle Mr. Doyle is President and CEO of Marsh McLennan. Previously, Mr. Doyle served as Group President and Chief Operating Officer, responsible for the strategy and operational objectives of Marsh McLennan’s four global businesses. He joined the firm in 2016 as President of Marsh, then led Marsh as President and CEO from 2017 to 2021. An industry veteran with more than 35 years of management experience, Mr. Doyle began his career at AIG, where he held several executive positions. He is a Trustee of the Inner-City Scholarship Fund, a member of the Board of Overseers of the Maurice R. Greenberg School of Risk Management, Insurance and Actuarial Science at St. John’s University, and a member of the Board of the New York Police and Fire Widows’ and Children’s Benefit Fund. Mr. Doyle serves as the Chairman of the US Federal Advisory Committee on Insurance. H. Edward Hanway Mr. Hanway served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of CIGNA Corporation from 2000 until his retirement in 2009. From 1999 to 2000, he served as President and Chief Operating Officer of CIGNA. From 1996 to 1999, he was President of CIGNA HealthCare and from 1989 to 1996 was President of CIGNA International. Mr. Hanway is a former member of the Board of Directors of America’s Health Insurance Plans (AHIP). He is also a past Chairman of the Council on Affordable Quality Healthcare (CAQH) and has been active in a wide range of issues and initiatives associated with children’s health and education. He serves on the Board of Trustees of Drexel Neumann Academy and was the Chairman of the Faith in the Future Foundation committed to growth of Catholic education in the Archdiocese of Philadelphia. Judith Hartmann Judith Hartmann is an Operating Partner at Sandbrook Capital, a private investment firm focused on transforming energy infrastructure. From 2015 to 2022, Judith Hartmann was Deputy CEO and Group Chief Financial Officer of ENGIE S.A., a French multi-national utility company operating in the fields of electricity generation, energy transportation and distribution and energy services. She was the interim Co-CEO in 2020. She held P&L responsibility for the North American and UK/Ireland business units and oversaw Procurement and Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR). Prior to ENGIE, Ms. Hartmann served as Chief Financial Officer and member of the Executive Board of the international media and services corporation Bertelsmann SE & Co. KGaA from 2012 to 2015. Prior to that, she served in a number of financial and operational roles at General Electric since 2000 in the US, Latin America and Europe, including at Global Service, GE Healthcare Clinical Systems, GE Water Europe, Middle East & Africa, GE Healthcare Latin America and GE Germany. Before that, she held positions in The Walt Disney Company and Transport Canada. Ms. Hartmann serves on the Board of Directors of Ørsted A/S. She was a Non-Executive Director of Unilever, Suez, Electrabel, International Power, RTL Group, Penguin Random House and Gruner + Jahr. She holds a PhD in Economics (Hons) and an MBA from the WU University of Business Administration and Economics. Deborah C. Hopkins Ms. Hopkins was the founder and Chief Executive Officer of Citi Ventures and served as Citigroup’s first Chief Innovation Officer. Previously at Citi she was Chief Operations and Technology Officer of the company, Chief Information Security Officer and Senior Advisor to the Corporate and Investment Bank. She retired at the end of 2016. Prior to joining Citigroup in 2003 as Head of Corporate Strategy and M&A, she was Chief Financial Officer of Lucent Technologies and The Boeing Company and held senior-level positions at General Motors in the U.S. and Zurich and at Unisys Corporation, after starting her career at Ford. Ms. Hopkins was twice named to Fortune’s 10 most powerful women in business and was on Institutional Investor’s Top 50 list every year from 2011 until she retired. She is a director of Union Pacific Corporation and privately-held cybersecurity company, Deep Instinct. She is a former director of Bridge Investment Group, Compass Digital Acquisition Corporation, Virtusa Corporation, Qlik Technologies, E.I. DuPont de Nemours & Company and Dendrite International. Ms. Hopkins holds honorary doctorate degrees from Westminster College and Walsh College and a B.A. in Accounting from Walsh College. Tamara Ingram Ms. Ingram was Global Chairman of Wunderman Thompson, an international global advertising agency. Ms. Ingram held previous roles at WPP plc, a media conglomerate, including Global Chief Executive Officer of J. Walter Thompson, Grey UK’s Group Chief Executive Officer, Global Leader on their Procter & Gamble account, as well as roles at WPP’s wholly owned data investment division, Kantar. Prior to joining WPP plc, Ms. Ingram was Chief Executive Officer of McCann Worldgroup in London and Chief Executive Officer of Saatchi & Saatchi’s London office. Ms. Ingram previously served as a non-executive director of London Stock Exchange-listed companies Sage Group plc and Serco Group plc. She is a Trustee of Save the Children International (UK) and was awarded an OBE (Officer of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire) for her services to tourism through her work as Chairman of Visit London. Ms. Ingram serves on the Board of Directors of Intertek plc, Marks & Spencer plc and Reckitt Benckiser Group plc. Jane Lute Ms. Lute is the Former Deputy Secretary of Homeland Security. She serves as a Strategic Director for SICPA North America, a company that protects the integrity and value of products, processes, and documents, including most of the world’s banknotes. Ms. Lute also served as Special Advisor to the Secretary-General of the United Nations, where she has held several positions in peacekeeping, peace building and political affairs. Previously, Ms. Lute served as Chief Executive Officer of the Center for Internet Security, an operating not-for-profit organization providing cybersecurity services for state, local, tribal and territorial governments. She began her distinguished career in the United States Army serving in Europe, Desert Storm, as well as on the National Security Council staff under both Presidents George H.W. Bush and William Jefferson Clinton. Ms. Lute holds a Ph.D. in political science from Stanford University and a J.D. from Georgetown University. Ms. Lute serves on the Board of Directors of Union Pacific Corporation and Shell plc and previously served as Director of Atlas Worldwide Holding Corporation. Steven A. Mills Mr. Mills was a senior executive at International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) before his retirement at the end of December 2015. Mr. Mills joined IBM in 1973 and during the course of his 40-plus-year career held various executive leadership positions across the company. At the time of his retirement, Mr. Mills was the Executive Vice President of Software & Systems, with responsibility for directing IBM’s $40 billion product business, which included over 100,000 employees spanning development, manufacturing, sales, marketing and support professions. Mr. Mills sits on Boards of privately held Syniti, Inc. and Accedian Networks, Inc. Morton O. Schapiro Mr. Schapiro is Executive Vice President and Senior Advisor of TWG Global and President Emeritus of Northwestern University. Prior to that, he was President and Professor of Economics at Northwestern University from 2009 to 2022. Previous positions include President and Professor at Williams College from 2000 to 2009, Dean of the College of Letters, Arts and Sciences of the University of Southern California from 1994 to 2000, the University's Vice President for planning from 1999 to 2000 and Chair of its Department of Economics from 1991 to 1994. Mr. Schapiro is among the nation’s leading authorities on the economics of higher education and has expertise in labor and development economics. Jan Siegmund Mr. Siegmund has over 30 years of experience in corporate finance, strategy and consulting. He served as Chief Financial Officer of Cognizant Technology Solutions, a professional services company, before retiring in early 2024. Prior to that, he was Corporate Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Automatic Data Processing (ADP), a global provider of cloud-based human capital management solutions. He joined ADP in 1999 and worked in various roles of increasing responsibility at the company including President, Added Value Services, and Chief Strategy Officer from 2009 to 2012. Mr. Siegmund also serves on the Board of Directors of Western Union. Lloyd M. Yates Mr. Yates is the President and Chief Executive Officer of NiSource Inc., a position he has held since 2022. From 2012 until his retirement in 2019, Mr. Yates served in senior leadership roles with Duke Energy, including Executive Vice President and President of Duke Energy’s Carolinas Region and Executive Vice President of Customer Operations. Mr. Yates has more than 40 years of experience in the energy industry, including the areas of nuclear and fossil energy generation and delivery. Before the merger between Duke Energy and Progress Energy in July 2012, Mr. Yates served as President and Chief Executive Officer for Progress Energy Carolinas. Mr. Yates joined Progress Energy’s predecessor, Carolina Power & Light, in 1998. Before joining Progress Energy, he worked for PECO Energy for 16 years in several line operations and management positions. Marsh McLennan is the leader in risk, strategy and people, helping clients navigate a dynamic environment through four global businesses.
